alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Coastal Ocean; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:48PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northern Atlantic, Ocean, southeastern Camden, east central Gloucester and Burlington Counties through 315 PM EST... At 247 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers with isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wrightstown to Chesilhurst. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Medford, Barnegat, Hammonton, Beachwood, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Presidential Lakes Estates, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Chesilhurst, Pemberton, Surf City, Port Republic, Wrightstown, Mantoloking and Atsion. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 48 and 90. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 29 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Camden; Coastal Ocean; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
